title: Session Logging: Capture and Export Detailed Practice Data
description:
## Executive Summary

Add comprehensive session logging to Piano Tutor that captures every MIDI event during practice sessions, enabling users to export and analyze their mistake patterns over time. This transforms ephemeral in-session stats into persistent, analyzable data.

## Problem Statement

The Piano Tutor app currently shows in-session stats (round count, first-try %, mistakes) but doesn't persist detailed practice data. Users cannot analyze patterns in their mistakes over time or identify which specific challenges (chords, intervals, progressions) cause consistent trouble. 

**Current State:** Stats disappear after each session; no way to identify persistent weak areas.
**Desired State:** Exportable practice data with keystroke-level detail for pattern analysis.

## Phases

1. Core Logging Infrastructure - Global state and lifecycle functions
2. MIDI Handler Instrumentation - Capture every noteOn/noteOff with timing
3. Mode Instrumentation - Hook all 20 practice modes into logging
4. Header Toggle Button - Quick on/off toggle during practice
5. Session Log Panel - Management interface for viewing/exporting data
6. JSON Export - Full structured data export
7. CSV Export Functions - Summary and detailed CSV formats
8. Storage Management - 100 session limit with export prompts
9. Settings Persistence - Remember enabled state across reloads

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Can export practice data and identify which specific chord types/intervals have highest mistake rates
- [ ] Data includes enough detail to see what wrong notes were played (not just "you made a mistake")
- [ ] Logging works consistently across all 20 practice modes

## Key Risks

- Large codebase (single file ~13k lines) - work in focused sections
- 20 modes to instrument - checklist approach, verify all covered
- localStorage limits (~5MB) - 100 session cap with size monitoring
- Performance impact - guard checks are fast, only record when enabled

## Reference

Specification: thoughts/specs/2026-01-17-session-logging.md
Implementation notes: docs/session-logging.md

title: Core Logging Infrastructure
description:
Implement the foundational logging infrastructure that all other session logging features depend on.

**What needs to be built:**
- Global state variables: `sessionLogEnabled`, `sessionLogSessions`, `currentSessionLog`
- Session lifecycle functions for starting, recording, and ending sessions
- Challenge normalizer to extract consistent `{prompt, pitchClasses}` from any mode's challenge format

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the core infrastructure - no UI, no exports, no mode integration
- Add around line 4268 in index.html per docs/session-logging.md

title: Session Log Panel
description:
Build the main management interface for session logging.

**What needs to be built:**
- Collapsible panel (hidden by default, around line 186)
- Enable/disable toggle with label
- Storage stats display: "X/100 sessions (~Y KB)"
- Export buttons: JSON, Summary CSV, Detailed CSV
- Recent sessions list (last 5-10 sessions with mode, date, round count)
- Clear All Data button with confirmation prompt
- Panel state persistence (expanded/collapsed)

**Scope boundaries:**
- This is the UI wrapper that calls export functions (built in separate tasks)
- Does not include storage limit notifications (that's Storage Management task)

title: Storage Management
description:
Implement storage limits and notifications to prevent localStorage overflow.

**What needs to be built:**
- 100 session maximum enforcement
- Notification at 90+ sessions: "Storage nearly full (95/100). Export your data?"
- Prompt at 100 sessions before new session starts
- Offer to clear oldest N sessions after export
- Storage size estimate calculation (from JSON string length)

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the storage management logic and notifications
- Storage stats display is in Session Log Panel task

title: Mode Instrumentation: All 20 Modes
description:
Add logging hooks to all 20 practice modes. Uses identical pattern for each mode.

**Modes to instrument (20 total):**

Chords Group:
1. chords, 2. inversions, 3. arpeg, 4. arpeg-inv, 5. voicing, 6. voice-leading, 7. chord-prog

Scales & Intervals Group:
8. scales, 9. scale-id, 10. intervals, 11. interval-id, 12. rel-pitch, 13. ear-train

Theory & Skills Group:
14. note-id, 15. key-sig, 16. ii-v-i, 17. tritone-sub, 18. melody-match, 19. rhythm, 20. sight-read

**Pattern for each mode (identical):**
- StartGame() calls sessionLogStartSession(mode, config)
- NextChallenge() calls sessionLogStartRound(challenge)
- Correct-answer handler calls sessionLogEndRound(result)
- EndGame() calls sessionLogEndSession(summary)

**Scope boundaries:**
- All 20 modes in one pass (pattern is identical per spec)
- Does not include MIDI handler (separate task)

title: MIDI Handler Instrumentation
description:
Add logging calls to the MIDI handler to capture every note played during practice.

**What needs to be built:**
- Modify handleMIDI() to call sessionLogRecordEvent on noteOn/noteOff
- Include guards to only record when logging is enabled and a session is active
- Calculate isCorrect flag based on expected pitch classes

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the handleMIDI() modifications around line 4455
- Does not include mode-specific handlers (those are separate tasks)

title: Header Toggle Button
description:
Add a quick toggle button in the header for turning session logging on/off.

**What needs to be built:**
- Toggle button in header area (near existing controls, ~line 140)
- Visual state indicator (e.g., "Log: On" / "Log: Off" or icon with indicator)
- Click handler to toggle sessionLogEnabled and call saveAllSettings()

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the header toggle UI and click handler
- Does NOT implement persistence - uses saveAllSettings() from Settings Persistence task
- Button styling should match existing header elements

title: JSON Export Function
description:
Implement JSON export for full session data.

**What needs to be built:**
- exportSessionLogJSON() function
- Metadata wrapper with export date, version, session count
- Download trigger with filename piano-tutor-sessions-{date}.json

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the JSON export - CSV exports are separate
- Does not include UI button (that's in Session Log Panel task)

title: CSV Export Functions
description:
Implement CSV export functions for spreadsheet analysis.

**What needs to be built:**
- exportSessionLogSummaryCSV() - one row per round
  - Columns: session_id, mode, config, round_num, challenge_prompt, expected_notes, response_ms, correct, mistakes, slow
- exportSessionLogDetailedCSV() - one row per MIDI event
  - Columns: session_id, mode, round_num, challenge_prompt, event_type, midi_note, note_name, octave, offset_ms, is_correct, round_result
- Proper CSV escaping for commas and quotes
- Download triggers with appropriate filenames

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the export functions - UI buttons are in Session Log Panel task

title: Settings Persistence
description:
Integrate session logging enabled state into existing settings system. This task OWNS the persistence mechanism.

**What needs to be built:**
- Add sessionLogEnabled to saveAllSettings() function
- Add sessionLogEnabled to loadAllSettings() function  
- Initialize sessionLogEnabled state on page load
- Update header toggle button visual state after load

**Scope boundaries:**
- Only the settings persistence integration around line 13363
- Header toggle button UI is separate task (uses this mechanism)
